### Improve template swap-merge for `model_documentation`, `validation_report`, and `monitoring` endpoints (#1383)

Send a JSON payload to the `model_documentation`, `validation_report`, or `monitoring` POST endpoint to create or replace documentation templates for inventory models. The request validates the `documentType`, retrieves the model with admin override, checks `to_template_cuid`, `to_template_version`, and `new_template_json`, swaps the template, saves the new version, and raises a `BadRequestError` if validation fails.

### Enhance metadata filtering in `Figure` model to handle `timestamp` values (#1393)

The `get_latest_figures` function now filters `datetime` and `date` metadata. If the value is a timestamp, it converts the JSON string to `datetime` using `SQLAlchemy`'s `func.cast`. Otherwise, it compares the raw string.

### Fix regression preventing document downloads (#1380)

The reporting endpoint first checks your `read` permission, then verifies the required rights: `download_doc` for `documentation-report` and `download_vr` for `validation-report`. Requesting an unknown report type results in a `BadRequestError`, while other exceptions are managed by the system.

### Increase `db` connections to prevent pool exhaustion using `SQLALCHEMY_POOL_SIZE` and `SQLALCHEMY_MAX_OVERFLOW` settings (#1388)

The connection pool defaults to 15 connections with a maximum of 25 overflow. You can override these limits using the `SQLALCHEMY_POOL_SIZE` and `SQLALCHEMY_MAX_OVERFLOW` environment variables. These values are applied to `app.config` for `Flask-SQLAlchemy`.

Configure the Flask API SQLAlchemy connection pool using the `SQLALCHEMY_POOL_SIZE` and `SQLALCHEMY_MAX_OVERFLOW` environment variables. If these are not set, the pool defaults to 25 connections with up to 15 overflow connections.

### Add date localization support with `FormattedDate` and `useFormattedDateAndTime` utilities (#1312)

Date display functions now accept a `locale` parameter, allowing you to format dates based on your preferences.

`FormattedDate` and `useFormattedDateAndTime` have replaced previous date utilities. All date displays, including admin pages, user views, templates, workflow executions, profile pages, activity feed, related modals, and the custom date picker, now align with your selected locale.

Your UI locale preference is saved to `localStorage` when changed.

New `OrganizationRow`, `RoleRow`, and `UserRow` components enhance the efficiency of admin tables.

### Local dev displays test message in `UI` (#10)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/433e6e73-dd0e-4714-a514-e226375669ad)

When running locally, we have logic that checks if litellm is running by sending a single "hello" to the llm. This is a great way to be able to fall back to the bare openai api if the developer doesn't want to run litellm locally. However the problem is that this invoke to the langchain llm client happens within the task node of the langgraph workflow. Meaning that the "Hello" back from the LLM is streamed to the UI. The solution is simply to remove the callbacks array when running `client.invoke()`.

### Update user guide with consolidated `attestation` section and enhanced `Mermaid` diagram theme colors and styles (#687)

`Model attestation` verifies key model details at a specific time for governance and compliance. It provides clear status updates and role-specific tasks to help you track progress.

See the guide to get started.

You can now access a consolidated attestation section that includes a workflow guide (setup, questionnaires, review), a glossary entry for `Attestation`, and related guides.

The `Mermaid` diagram theme now features updated node and edge colors, along with rounded node corners.


<!--- PR #686: https://github.com/validmind/documentation/pull/686 --->
<!--- Labels: documentation --->
### Manage model stakeholder types in `documentation` for easier configuration and permissions management (#686)

You can now manage model stakeholders more easily. A new `Model stakeholder types` page under `Managing users`, accessible from the landing page, replaces role-based references in `Model inventory fields`, allowing you to edit model stakeholders.

`manage-model-stakeholder-types.qmd`: Manage stakeholder types, assign them to models, and configure permissions.

`manage-roles.qmd`: Manage roles, set permissions, link users, and ensure unique names.

`edit-model-inventory-fields.qmd` and `manage-model-inventory-fields.qmd`: Use stakeholder types to configure inventory field permissions.

`managing-users.qmd`: Align grid columns and update wording.


<!--- PR #689: https://github.com/validmind/documentation/pull/689 --->
<!--- Labels: documentation --->
### Add new introductory `validation` notebooks with updated security sections and clearer instructions (#689)

You can now access model-validation and development notebooks directly from the library portal. Notebook numbering has been updated.

Language, links, and styling are consistent with the `API` documentation, and notebook titles are shortened.

The landing section uses a dedicated `_sidebar.yaml` for easier navigation.

The validmind.com link has been removed from the top navigation but remains in the footer.

The documentation now includes updated security sections with clearer instructions, setup guides, and examples.

You can run additional tests with broader coverage for model validation and data quality. The refactored code and reorganized test files improve readability, resolve minor execution and logging issues, and ensure that results and logs handle sensitive data more securely.
